titleInfo.title: Tintype of Mrs. George Land, circa 1870s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Framed black and white tintype of Mrs. George Land with hand tinted photograph of white child framed behind the photograph of Mrs. Land. Mrs. Land is dressed in a long-sleeved high-necked gown, and is holding a hat with feathered decoration. The white child is sitting on a chair draped with fabric. On the reverse of the photograph is the following inscription: "From H. Minnis 506 Pontatoc Ave, Memphis, Tennessee Picture Brust." H. Minnis is believed to be a member of the family for whom Mrs. George Land worked.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
